Booleans: BOOLEAN: BER: as 1 byte in binary form
String: INTEGER: BER: variable-length big-endian binary representation (up to 2^(2^1024) bits)
Array: PER Unaligned: a fixed number of bits if the integer type has a finite range
Associative array/Object: a variable number of bits otherwise
column9: PER Aligned: a fixed number of bits if the integer type has a finite range and the size of the range is less than 65536
column10: a variable number of octets otherwise
column11: OER: one, two, or four octets (either signed or unsigned) if the integer type has a finite range that fits in that number of octets
column12: a variable number of octets otherwise
column13: REAL: base-10 real values are represented as character strings in ISO 6093 format
column14: binary real values are represented in a binary format that includes the mantissa, the base (2, 8, or 16), and the exponent
column15: the special values NaN, -INF, +INF, and negative zero are also supported
column16: Multiple valid types (VisibleString, PrintableString, GeneralString, UniversalString, UTF8String)
column17: data specifications SET OF (unordered) and SEQUENCE OF (guaranteed order)

Integer: u8, u16, u32, u64 Big-endian fixed size unsigned integers. i8, i16, i32, i64 Big-endian two's complement signed integers. uv Variable length unsigned integer with a compact encoding.
Floating-point: f32, f64 Single and double precision big-endian floats.
Array: array x Length-prefixed sequence of any type. n x Fixed-length array.
Associative array/Object: tuple Fixed size object, encoded as the concatenation of all members. map k v Key-value map of arbitrary size, encoded as an array of pairs.

Integer: big-endian 2's complement signed and unsigned 8/16/32/64 bits
Floating-point: single: big-endian binary32 double: big-endian binary64
String: UTF-8 encoded, null terminated, preceded by int8 or int32 string length in bytes
Array: Typecode (one byte) + 1-4 bytes size + 1-4 bytes items count + list items
Associative array/Object: Typecode (one byte) + 1-4 bytes size + 1-4 bytes items count + key/value pairs

Integer: Single byte integers in the range [-32
Floating-point: 127] Fixed length integers for 8-bits, 16-bits, 32-bits, and 64-bits integers. Encoded as two's complement little-endian values.
Associative array/Object: Balanced brackets with an optional array count. Arrays can be nested.
column9: Balanced brackets with an optional object count. Objects can be nested.

Integer: int32: 32-bit little-endian 2's complement or int64: 64-bit little-endian 2's complement
String: UTF-8 encoded, preceded by int32 encoded string length in bytes
Array: BSON embedded document with numeric keys

Integer:
Small positive number \x00-\x17, small negative number \x20-\x37 (abs(N) <= 23) 8-bit: positive \x18\xhh, negative \x38\xhh 16-bit: positive \x19, negative \x39
32-bit: positive \x1A, negative \x3A
64-bit: positive \x1B, negative \x3B
Negative number x encoded as ~x (binary inversion) or as (-x-1)
Byte order{{snd}} [[Big-endian]]
String: Typecode with length (like integer coding) and content. Bytestring and UTF-8 have different typecode
Array: Typecode with count (like integer coding) and items
Associative array/Object: Typecode with pairs count (like integer coding) and pairs

Null: xsi:nil element (1-4 bits depending on context)
Integer: 0–12 bits (log2 range) bits for integers with defined ranges less than 4096. Extensible sequence of octets with infinite range for larger or undefined ranges. Also supports custom representations.
Floating-point: Scalable floating point representation requiring 18 to 88 bits depending on magnitude. Also supports IEEE and custom representations.
String: Length prefixed sequence of Unicode code points with partitioned string tables for efficient representation of repeated items. The length and code points are represented as variable length unsigned integers where values under 128 require 1 octet each. Also supports custom representations.
Array: Repeated elements or length-prefixed list of values. Also supports custom representations.
Associative array/Object: Ordered (sequence) or unordered (all) group of named elements.

Null: Encoded optional types: int32? null: \x00 value: \x01
Booleans: Single byte boolean: bool True: \x01 False: \x00
Integer: Little-endian encoded signed integer: int8, int16, int32, int64 Little-endian encoded unsigned integer: uint8, uint16, uint32, uint64
Floating-point: Little-endian encoded floats: float Little-endian encoded doubles: double Little-endian encoded decimals: decimal
String: Single byte character: char Little-endian encoded 32 bit Unicode character: wchar UTF-8 encoded string, preceded by length (32 bit) in bytes: string
Array: Vector of any other type, preceded by its length (32 bit) and relative offset (32 bit) Fixed size array: int32[10] Dynamic vector: int32[] Linked list: int32() Set: int32!
Associative array/Object: Vector of (key, value) pairs, preceded by its length (32 bit) and relative offset (32 bit) Ordered map: int32 Unordered hash table: int32{string}

Null: Encoded as absence of field in parent object
Integer: little-endian 2's complement signed and unsigned 8/16/32/64 bits
Floating-point: floats: little-endian binary32 doubles: little-endian binary64
String: UTF-8 encoded, preceded by 32 bit integer length of string in bytes
Array: Vectors of any other type, preceded by 32 bit integer length of number of elements
Associative array/Object: Tables (schema defined types) or Vectors sorted by key (maps / dictionaries)

Integer: Single byte "fixnum" (values -32..127) or typecode (one byte) + big-endian (u)int8/16/32/64
String: Typecode + up to 15 bytes or typecode + length as uint8/16/32 + bytes
Associative array/Object: As "fixarray" (single-byte prefix + up to 15 array items) or typecode (one byte) + 2–4 bytes length + array items
column9: As "fixmap" (single-byte prefix + up to 15 key-value pairs) or typecode (one byte) + 2–4 bytes length + key-value pairs

Integer:
Variable encoding length signed 32-bit: varint encoding of "ZigZag"-encoded value (n << 1) [[XOR]] (n >> 31) Variable encoding length signed 64-bit: varint encoding of "ZigZag"-encoded (n << 1) XOR (n >> 63)
Constant encoding length 32-bit: 32 bits in [[little-endian]] [[2's complement]]
Constant encoding length 64-bit: 64 bits in [[little-endian]] [[2's complement]]
Floating-point: floats: little-endian binary32 doubles: little-endian binary64
String: UTF-8 encoded, preceded by varint-encoded integer length of string in bytes
Array: Repeated value with the same tag

Integer: Single byte POS/NEG (values -16..15) or typecode (one byte) + "varint" encoded variable length integer or typecode (one byte) + "zigzag" encoded variable length integer
String: As "SHORT_BINARY" (single-byte prefix + up to 31 raw bytes) or typecode (one byte, including boolean UTF8-encoding flag) + "varint" encoded length + raw bytes
Array: As "ARRAYREF" (single-byte prefix + up to 15 array items) or typecode (one byte) + "varint" encoded length + array items
Associative array/Object: As "HASHREF" (single-byte prefix + up to 15 key-value pairs) or typecode (one byte) + "varint" encoded length + key-value pairs. Distinguishes hashmaps from objects / class instances.

Integer: Single byte "small" (values -16..15 encoded using \xc0 - \xdf), zigzag-encoded varints (1–11 data bytes), or BigInteger
String: Length-prefixed "short" Strings (up to 64 bytes), marker-terminated "long" Strings and (optional) back-references

Array: list of elements with identical ID and size, preceded by array header with int16 length
Associative array/Object: chunks can contain other chunks to arbitrary depth

Integer: signed integers, little-endian, 1 to 8 bytes, 2's complement: 0x20-0x27 + int
Floating-point: unsigned integers, little-endian, 1 to 8 bytes: 0x28-0x2f + uint
Associative array/Object: UTC-date in milliseconds since the epoch, little-endian, 2's complement: 0x1c + uint64
column10: positive long packed BCD-encoded float: 0xc8-0xcf + 8 bytes
column11: negative long packed BCD-encoded float: 0xd0-0xd7 + 8 bytes
column13: variable length UTF-8 string, little-endian, unsigned integer, not zero-terminated and may contain zero bytes: 0xbf + 8 bytes byte-length + string
column15: array without index table, all sub items 1/2/4/8 bytes byte-length
column16: array with 1/2/4/8 byte index table offsets, byte-length and number of sub values
column19: object with 1/2/4/8 byte index table offsets, sorted by attribute name, 1/2/4/8 byte byte-length and number of sub values
column20: object with 1/2/4/8 byte index table offsets, not sorted by attribute name, 1/2/4/8 byte byte-length and number of sub values
